0: From left to right: Ashley Waddell, Ryan Thompson, and their children Gaven and Bridgit. (Photo: Submitted photo/Special to the Register) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A Des Moines father died after a single punch to the face during a bizarre encounter with a stranger Monday afternoon. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Ryan Thompson, 32, was talking with his fiancee outside their home in the 7300 block of Southwest 17th Street around 3 p.m. when a man driving a dark-colored Sedan stopped and approached them, according to police records. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "You owe me money," he said, and punched Thompson once on the side of the face, the report states. He then walked back to his car and drove away. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Thompson was dazed, but he made his way inside the home to wait for medics. Officers reported that he was speaking unintelligibly and slurring his words. The fiancee told police that Thompson was not intoxicated. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He died a day later at Iowa Methodist Medical Center. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A 10-year-old witness described the suspect to police as a white man in his 40s, with long, slicked-back black hair and a clean-shaven face. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The fiancee told police she did not know the man and said the assault was unprovoked. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Detectives have identified a suspect but no charges were filed as of Wednesday afternoon. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Polk County Medical Examiner Gregory Schmunk said Wednesday that an autopsy was conducted, but he will not determine a cause of death until all test results are available. That could take eight to 10 weeks, he said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Thompson's ex-wife, Ashley Waddell, 32, described him as an amazing father. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "He was in love with his children," she said. "They hold him on a pedestal that no one can touch." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Waddell and Thompson began dating while students at Southeast Polk High School. They had two children together; a son, Gaven, was born in 2002, and daughter Bridgit arrived three years later. They divorced in August 2015. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "He was the life of every party. He was so funny and had a huge heart. He truly made every one light up the moment he stepped in the room," Waddell said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The family will hold funeral services for Thompson on Saturday morning.
